results.firPara: The former Liverpool, West Ham United and Cameroon defender Rigobert Song is reportedly fighting for his life after being rushed to hospital in Yaounde.
results.secPara: The 40-year-old is the uncle of former Arsenal, West Ham United and Charlton Athletic midfielder Alex.
results.webTitle: Former Liverpool defender Rigobert Song fighting for life after stroke

results.firPara: • Italian saw his side lose 2-0 to Preston on Saturday
results.secPara: Aston Villa have parted company with manager Roberto Di Matteo after only 12 matches in charge.
results.webTitle: Aston Villa confirm sacking of Roberto Di Matteo after 12 games

results.firPara: Shkodran Mustafi revelled in bruising battle with Sam Vokes but last-minute goal off an arm was fair reflection of Arsenals attacking threat against Burnley

results.webTitle: Arsenal fortune not fluency earns Arsène Wenger gift on 20th anniversary

results.firPara: Jürgen Klopp believes he has already confounded some of those who doubted whether he could manage in the Premier League, as he approaches his first anniversary in charge at Anfield, but the German will have no time for reflection as he seeks to keep driving Liverpool forward.
results.secPara: Saturdays 2-1 victory over Swansea was Liverpools fourth in succession in the league, maintaining their excellent start to the season, even if the first-half performance had Klopp in a rage at the interval.
results.webTitle: Jürgen Klopp content but in no mood for cake on Liverpool anniversary

results.firPara: Antonio Conte praised the impact Victor Moses had in his new-look Chelsea side and said he could be a good fit for a right-wing-back position this season.
results.secPara: Moses started a Premier League game for Chelsea for the first time since May 2013, a total of 1,239 days, in the 2-0 victory against Hull City and proved a dangerous outlet going forward and equally comfortable when defending.
results.webTitle: Chelsea’s Antonio Conte praises impact of adaptable Victor Moses at Hull

results.firPara: Roberto Di Matteo will be sacked as Aston Villa manager after Tony Jiantong Xia, the clubs owner, accepted that there is little option but to make a change after such a disappointing start to the season. Senior club officials will hold further talks on Monday, with Di Matteos departure viewed as a formality and attention already turning to the Italians replacement.
results.secPara: The early indications are that Steve Bruce, who is out of work, and David Wagner, the manager of high-flying Huddersfield Town, are the leading contenders for the position. Bruce would bring with him experience of winning promotion from the Championship while Wagner has made a stunning impact since taking over at Huddersfield in November last year.
results.webTitle: Aston Villa to sack Roberto Di Matteo as Tony Jiantong Xia loses patience

results.firPara: Gareth Southgate has resisted any temptation to recall Jack Wilshere and Ross Barkley in his first England squad but has brought back Glen Johnson for the first time since the World Cup two years ago.
results.secPara: Johnson, 32, has been offered a chance to reignite his international career because Nathaniel Clyne has been ruled out, along with his Liverpool team-mate Adam Lallana, after the pair picked up injuries at Swansea City on Saturday.
results.webTitle: Gareth Southgate recalls Glen Johnson for England and picks Marcus Rashford
